title: The half-angle formula for sine is $$sin\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)=\sqrt{\frac{1-cos\left(\theta\right)}{2}}$$ (plus or minus)

It easier to notice that $$sin\left(\frac{11\pi}{12}\right)$$ $$=$$ sin(pi - pi/12) $$=$$ $$sin\left(\frac{\pi}{12}\right)$$ and use $$\frac{\pi}{12}$$ as our theta. Also, since $$\frac{\pi}{12}$$ is in quadrant I, we choose the positive square root.
Next, calculate our half-angle, plug this value into the previous formula and solve.
